title: Montana St. tops Illinois St. in wild FCS title game
content: Montana State won its first national championship since 1984 in Monday's first OT in FCS title game history.

title: KD savors winner vs. Suns after being 'kicked out'
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant said hitting the winning shot Monday night against the Suns meant more because it came against his former team, one "that booted you out of the building and scapegoated you for all the problems they had."

title: Sources: RB Lacy signs new deal with Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss star running back Kewan Lacy signed a deal to return for the Rebels in 2026, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Day after Huskers pledge, QB Minchey flips to UK
content: One day after announcing his commitment to Nebraska, transfer quarterback Kenny Minchey, the former Notre Dame backup, has flipped to Kentucky, he told ESPN on Monday.

title: Sources: Hawks, Young working together on trade
content: Atlanta Hawks four-time All-Star Trae Young and his agent, Aaron Mintz, are working with the franchise on a trade, sources told ESPN.

title: Tua: Getting a fresh start in '26 'would be dope'
content: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is open to a "fresh start," he told reporters Monday, after he was benched for the team's final three games of the season.

title: Kerr ejected, Curry fouls out as calls rile Warriors
content: Warriors coach Steve Kerr was ejected from his team's 103-102 loss to the Clippers in the fourth quarter Monday night after a string of officiating decisions set him off on the sideline. Stephen Curry also fouled out for the first time since 2021.

title: Ravens sing Lamar's praises as season falls flat
content: Quarterback Lamar Jackson has the support of his teammates after an injury-marred season that saw the Ravens miss the playoffs for the first time since 2021.

title: Knicks 'gotta respond' after Pistons drubbing
content: The Knicks agreed that "a lot needs to be addressed" after a blowout loss to the East-leading Pistons, New York's fourth straight defeat.

title: ✍ 2026 NFL draft order: First 18 slots are set
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order -- plus each team's top need -- after the regular season.

title: Barnwell makes his NFL award picks: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Drake Maye or Matthew Stafford for MVP? Which rookies should earn hardware? And no one is beating out Myles Garrett for DPOY, right?

title: The NFL playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: The 2025 NFL playoff field is set, and an exciting wild-card round looms. Here's everything to know about the 14 teams vying to win Super Bowl LX.

title: Browns in full reset mode: Here's what we know after ouster of Kevin Stefanski
content: In search of a new coach, Cleveland enters an offseason with first-round picks and unsettled questions at QB.

title: MVP, ROY, All-NBA teams and more: Predictions for all the league's highest honors
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton projects the favorites to win each award and make the All-NBA teams, as well as other contenders and long shots.

title: Man United must go big and hire a superstar manager after firing Ruben Amorim
content: It is time for one of the most powerful clubs in the world to hire a manager with the experience, track record, credentials and personality befitting Man United's status.

title: 'Fragile' no more: How the Bears' Caleb Williams, Ben Johnson evolved
content: Caleb Williams thought Ben Johnson didn't like him at one point, but the duo evolved to lead the playoff-bound Bears.

title: SC Next Top 25: The best high school boys' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Link Academy (Miss.) takes the No. 1 spot to start the calendar year, with Spire Academy (Ohio) making the biggest jump to No. 2 in January.

title: SC Next Top 25: The best high school girls' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Ontario Christian (Calif.) stays atop the 2025-26 SC Next girls' high school rankings as the showcase of the month is the Hoophall Classic.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Michigan State, Kansas stumble
content: Nebraska cracks the top 10. SMU and UCF replace Florida and USC. See more changes after the two-week hiatus.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: NHL's best this week: Who wins a series between U.S.-Canada Olympic B-teams?
content: Many superstars were left off the rosters. Here's how two teams of snubs look -- and who would win a seven-game series.

title: Pro wrestling awards 2025: Dominik Mysterio, Stephanie Vaquer and an AEW resurgence
content: Pro wrestling insiders identify their top stars and biggest moments of 2025 in WWE, AEW and other top promotions.

title: VAR review: Why was Wirtz onside in Premier League, offside in Europe?
content: Liverpool had a goal from Florian Wirtz ruled out vs. Fulham, but it was overturned by VAR on the slimmest of margins. Why?

title: VAR doesn't interfere with second yellow cards. But should it?
content: Despite some major incidents lately, VAR is unable to get involved in second yellow cards. Here's why.

title: NLL Week 6 highlights: Rush, Bandits back on top of the standings
content: Are Saskatchewan and Buffalo headed to a championship-round rematch? Here's what went down in Week 6.

title: Fantasy football year in review: MVP, biggest bust and season highlights
content: A summary of the best fantasy performances, biggest storylines, surprises and disappointments, along with the usual dose of historical perspective.

title: Mike Clay's early 2026 fantasy football PPR rankings
content: A look at the position-by-position rankings for the 2026 fantasy season, updated throughout the offseason.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus eye Chiesa, Sørloth
content: Juventus are looking to boost their forward line by looking at deals for Liverpool's Federico Chiesa and Atlético Madrid's Alexander Sørloth. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Make these fights, UFC: Makhachev-Topuria, Jones-Pereira and more
content: From superfights to title rematches to downright epics, these 10 matchups need to be booked this year.

title: Delhi man walks into police station, confesses to killing mother, 2 siblings
content: A 25-year-old man confessed to police in Delhi, claiming he drugged and strangled his mother, sister, and teenage brother. Financial stress and marital discord reportedly fueled the horrific act. The accused allegedly used sedatives from dhatura seeds mixed into prasad laddoos before committing the murders. Police are awaiting autopsy reports for confirmation.

title: Delhi: 46L households paid zero electricity bill in Dec; subsidy outlay set to cross Rs 4,000 cr
content: Delhi's free electricity scheme reached over 90% of households in December 2025, with 73% paying no bill. The scheme, offering free power up to 200 units and 50% subsidy up to 400 units, saw sustained coverage, benefiting nearly 8 in 10 domestic consumers on average last year.

title: ‘Wakf has no locus standi’: Madras HC upholds single bench's order; allows lighting deepam atop hill
content: The Madras High Court has upheld a single judge's order. The Subramaniya Swamy temple management must light the Karthigai deepam at the deepathoon atop Thiruparankundram hill. The court found no valid reason to deny this practice. The stone pillar is located on Devasthanam land. The court directed the Devasthanam to comply with the order during the Karthigai festival.

title: Kolkata Chess: Story behind India's only Super Rapid & Blitz event
content: Kolkata has become a vibrant hub for world chess, hosting an elite rapid and blitz tournament with roots tracing back to a Dutch steel company's initiative in 1938. This annual spectacle, now in its seventh edition, showcases top international and Indian talent, fostering a strong sporting culture and engaging a passionate audience.

title: Fresh unrest in Nepal? Border area near India placed under curfew — what triggered it
content: Religious tensions flared in Birgunj, Nepal, following a provocative TikTok video, leading authorities to extend an ongoing curfew.  Despite the prohibitory order, two groups held simultaneous demonstrations, prompting a full curfew with shoot-on-sight orders for security personnel. The unrest, initially sparked by a video in Dhanusha, spread rapidly, causing widespread disruption.

title: Apple execs book long stays in S Korea — driven by Samsung and SK Hynix talks
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: $20,000 instead of Rs 20,000: How a typo left Kerala University poorer by Rs 16 lakh
content: A costly bank error at Kerala University's Centre for Latin American Studies resulted in a Rs 16.5 lakh loss. A typo swapped '₹' for '$' during a payment to a guest lecturer's wife, sending $20,000 instead of Rs 20,000. Efforts to recover the excess funds have failed, with the lecturer passing away before repayment.

title: Steve Smith overtakes Don Bradman - Now behind are only Virat and Sachin
content: Australia's Steven Smith has become cricket's highest run-scorer against England, surpassing Don Bradman with his 37th Test century. This remarkable achievement places him behind only Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli in all-time international runs against a single opponent. Smith's masterclass at the SCG further solidified his dominance in the Ashes.

title: Math genius Joel David Hamkins says AI models are basically useless for math tasks
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Mustafizur controversy: Big loss for Bangladesh cricket not playing in India
content: Following the BCCI's directive to release Mustafizur Rahman from the IPL, Bangladesh have announced their withdrawal from the T20 World Cup 2026 in India due to security concerns. The government has also suspended IPL broadcasts, sparking debate about separating politics from cricket.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold cost in your city - Check rates
content: Gold prices surged on Tuesday, driven by escalating political instability in Venezuela and heightened US-Latin America tensions, prompting investors to seek safe-haven assets. February gold futures on MCX climbed by Rs 445, while international Comex futures advanced, reflecting a growing demand for the precious metal amid global uncertainties.  Local prices varied across major Indian cities.

title: OpenAI IPO plans: Altman says he has no interest in CEO role; timeline remains uncertain
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed zero enthusiasm for leading a public company, despite acknowledging an IPO is likely necessary for capital and growth.  While he finds public market participation in value creation appealing, he anticipates the process will be 'annoying.'  The AI giant, valued at potentially $1 trillion, is reportedly preparing for a 2026 or 2027 listing.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection day 33: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer begins to slow down
content: Dhurandhar continues its record-breaking run, surpassing Pushpa 2 to become the highest-grossing Hindi film ever. Despite a slight slowdown after the holiday window, the Ranveer Singh starrer has amassed an impressive Rs 777.78 crore. This non-sequel hit now sets its sights on outperforming Pushpa 2 in future installments.

title: Civic wars 2026: Thackerays reunite, alliances shift — Maharashtra's BMC power game explained
content: Maharashtra gears up for crucial local body elections on January 15, marking the first electoral test of 2026. These polls, delayed by legal battles, will see alliances like the Mahayuti and Maha Vikas Aghadi vying for control of key urban centers, including the financially significant Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation.

title: AIIMS doctor questions science behind Deepinder Goyal’s temple device
content: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal launched the Temple device, a wearable aiming to monitor cerebral blood flow and link it to his Gravity Aging Hypothesis. However, medical professionals like Dr. Suvrankar Datta criticize it as an unproven "fancy toy for billionaires" lacking scientific standing and clinical trials, urging caution for consumers.

title: 'Culprit not her ex-boyfriend': Was Hyd woman working in US murdered over money?
content: A 27-year-old Indian woman, Nikitha Godishala, was found murdered in Maryland, USA. Police are searching for Arjun Sharma, who allegedly fled to India after borrowing money from Nikitha. Her father clarified Sharma was not her ex-boyfriend but a former housemate. The incident has deeply impacted the Indian community.

title: Wipro asks employees to work at least 6 hours from office - check new rules
content: Wipro has rolled out a stricter hybrid work policy from January 1, 2026 which required employees to spend at least six hours in office on three days a week, with leave deduction penalty for shortfalls.

title: Is Jana Nayagan a remake of Bhagavanth Kesari?
content: Jana Nayagan, featuring Thalapathy Vijay, is stirring buzz over possible connections to the popular Telugu film Bhagavanth Kesari. Although the production secured rights for a particular sequence, director H Vinoth encourages fans to form their own opinions about the movie's originality once it's released. It seems poised to deliver a fresh take on the political action genre with nuanced adaptations.

title: Suspicious timing! Mystery trader makes $436,000 predicting Maduro’s capture
content: A massive payout on an online prediction market following the US announcement of Nicolas Maduro's capture has sparked concerns. A trader reportedly bet over $32,000 on Maduro's removal just before the news broke, netting over $436,000. Experts point to insider trading, highlighting regulatory gaps in prediction markets.

title: JNU students raise slogans against PM Modi, Amit Shah after SC denies bail to Umar Khalid
content: JNU students protested controversial slogans against PM Modi and Amit Shah following the Supreme Court's denial of bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam. The student union president stated the slogans were ideological, not personal attacks. This protest occurred after a 2020 campus violence incident where masked individuals attacked students and damaged property.

title: 'My son wasn’t even in Delhi during riots': Umar Khalid's father
content: Supreme Court denied bail to student activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, deeming their roles distinct from five others granted relief. Families expressed deep disappointment and a sense of injustice, highlighting years of incarceration without trial. While relieved for the other accused, they lamented the continued struggle for their loved ones' freedom.

title: Rs 9.20 cr at stake? Mustafizur set to walk away empty-handed after KKR release
content: Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman is unlikely to get paid by Kolkata Knight Riders after his IPL contract termination. Despite being a high-value signing, his release, not due to injury or misconduct, leaves him unprotected by insurance and contractual clauses. This situation highlights player rights issues and potential legal avenues for the bowler.

title: 'Shot of lifetime': S Korea's Lee takes selfie with Xi months after 'backdoor' phone joke
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung shared a selfie with Chinese President Xi Jinping and their wives on X, taken with a Xiaomi phone gifted by Xi. The leaders engaged in lighthearted banter about the phone's security, with Xi humorously suggesting Lee check for backdoors. This interaction occurred during Lee's visit to Beijing, aimed at improving bilateral ties.

title: Kartik Aaryan holidaying in Goa with mystery girl? Actor unfollows teen amid linkup rumours
content: Rumors are swirling around Kartik Aaryan and a mysterious figure named Karina Kubiliute, after their recent Goa getaway sparked interest online. Observant netizens have compared their vacation photos, highlighting matching beach towels and a volleyball court. Adding to the intrigue, Kartik's brief Instagram follow of Karina has since turned into an unfollow, leaving fans buzzing with questions.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are prices headed in the near-term? Check outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan is of the view that gold prices may continue to rally as demand for safe haven assets picks up.

title: Big call, poor returns: Arjun Tendulkar's opening move backfires in Vijay Hazare Trophy
content: Arjun Tendulkar's stint as an opener for Goa in the Vijay Hazare Trophy has yielded disappointing results, with the young cricketer struggling to make an impact.  Meanwhile, Yograj Singh, Yuvraj's father, claims Arjun is being miscoached, emphasizing his batting prowess over bowling, and alleges past opportunities were denied.

title: 13-year wait ends! World champion Kranti Goud’s rise restores honour
content: India's World Cup star Kranti Goud's success has led to her father's reinstatement in the Madhya Pradesh Police after a 13-year suspension. The state government fulfilled a promise made to Kranti, restoring her father's dignity and ensuring his honorable retirement. This humane gesture highlights the government's respect for athletes and their families.

title: Schools closed in these states due to cold wave and fog: Check full list of holidays here
content: Several Indian states are extending school closures due to severe cold waves and dense fog. Rajasthan, Tripura, and Jharkhand have announced holidays for students of various grades, prioritizing their health amidst plummeting temperatures. While students are home, staff are generally required to report to schools, and examinations are proceeding as planned in some regions.

title: More countries face $15,000 US visa bonds requirements! Check full list here
content: The United States has expanded a visa rule requiring financial bonds from travelers, adding seven new countries to the list. This policy, now affecting 13 nations, primarily in Africa, mandates bonds of $5,000 to $15,000 to deter visa overstays. The move raises concerns about affordability and is part of broader US entry rule tightening.

title: Opposition MLAs come to house wearing masks; speaker suspends four
content: Four AAP MLAs faced suspension from the Delhi assembly for the remainder of the winter session. They wore gas masks during Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena's address to protest severe air pollution. Opposition leader Atishi alleged the BJP government refused to discuss the issue. Environment minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa countered, accusing AAP of avoiding debate and exposing their failures.

title: Sudden brake injures Jyotiraditya Scindia’s son who was greeting people from car's sunroof
content: Mahanaryaman Scindia, son of Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, sustained a chest injury in Shivpuri, Madhya Pradesh, after his car's driver applied sudden brakes. He was standing through the sunroof and waving when the incident occurred. After examination and medication at the district hospital, he was discharged and advised to wear a belt.

title: Mustafizur snub fallout: Bangladesh await ICC call on WC venues
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formally requested the ICC to relocate their T20 World Cup matches from India, citing security concerns following the IPL squad release of Mustafizur Rahman. BCB president Aminul Islam emphasized that their next steps depend entirely on the ICC's response, clarifying this is an ICC event, not a bilateral matter.

title: Rupee rebounds! Currency rises 18 paise to 90.12 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee strengthened by 14 paise to 90.16 against the US dollar on Tuesday, recovering from a four-day losing streak. This rebound follows a dip on Monday, attributed to geopolitical uncertainty and weak domestic equities, with the dollar gaining traction as investors sought safe-haven assets after a US military operation in Venezuela.

title: Former Union minister Suresh Kalmadi passes away at 81
content: Veteran politician and former Union minister Suresh Kalmadi has passed away in Pune after a prolonged illness. Known for his extensive involvement in sports administration, including his tenure as IOA president, Kalmadi's career was marked by both significant contributions and controversy surrounding the 2010 Commonwealth Games. His mortal remains will be available for public viewing before cremation.

title: 'Fell into Pak trap': Minor shares security info with ISI, terror groups; arrested in Pathankot
content: Pathankot police apprehended a 15-year-old boy for allegedly leaking national security details to Pakistan's ISI and military.  Exploiting his emotional vulnerability over a suspected father's murder, Pakistani handlers lured him via social media.  The juvenile had shared sensitive location videos and communicated with Pakistan-based terror operatives for nearly a year.

title: Top stocks to buy: Market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends buying Prestige, Great Eastern Shipping Company, and Nuvama. Let’s take a look:

title: What is the viral ‘Oatzempic’ trend? Does it actually help in weight loss?
content: A viral TikTok trend called "Oatzempic" claims a simple oat and citrus drink can mimic Ozempic's weight loss effects. However, nutrition experts clarify that this concoction, while filling due to fiber, lacks the hormonal impact of the prescription drug. Sustainable weight loss requires balanced diet and exercise, not quick online fixes.

title: 'I am a decent man': Venezuela's Maduro pleads not guilty in US court
content: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to all charges in a US courtroom, asserting his continued leadership. Captured at his Caracas home, Maduro appeared in prison attire, shackled, and with translation headphones. His defense attorney confirmed the not guilty plea. Further court proceedings are anticipated soon.

title: Thane jail inmate manhandles cop, smashes CCTV cameras; booked
content: The accused claimed he was "unfazed" by legal action because he had faced similar charges in the past

title: HC tells TTD to come up with fresh plan on Parakamani
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court gave liberty to the CID to take action against the police officers who are allegedly involved in the conspiracy (theft of foreign currency) as per the TTD report

title: Suresh Kalmadi ushered in the golden era of Congress in Pune
content: Kalmadi was Railways Minister when Mumbai’s iconic Victoria Terminus was renamed Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus

title: Indian Embassy used Trump aide’s firm to deal with trade talks, Operation Sindoor and bilateral ties
content: According to FARA filings, lobby firm SHW was asked to schedule meetings for Minister, FS and Ambassador with US senior officials Hegseth, Vance, and CIA chief Ratcliffe

title: Siddaramaiah breaks Devaraj Urs’s record of being the longest-serving CM of Karnataka
content: In addition to the earlier three socio-political reforms in Karnataka – land redistribution, reservation, and decentralisation – the Bhagyas/guarantees schemes of Siddaramaiah are considered the fourth passive revolution after the reorganisation of the State

title: 12 crude bombs seized in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Bomb recoveries prompt heightened security measures in areas that have witnessed political clashes in the past

title: Umar Khalid verdict: JNU students raise controversial slogans against PM, Shah
content: "All of the slogans raised in the protest were ideological and do not attack anyone personally. They were not directed towards anyone," says JNU Students' Union president

title: Bank fraud: Supreme Court grants bail to Amtek Group ex-chairperson in ED case
content: The Delhi High Court had denied bail to Mr. Dham on August 19 last year, saying premature release could risk undermining efforts to secure accountability

title: Thirupparankundram row: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court upholds order directing temple management to light Karthigai Deepam at ‘deepathoon’
content: The Tamil Nadu government had submitted that there was no evidence to establish that the stone pillar in Thirupparankundram hill was a ‘deepathoon’

title: Bomb threat triggers panic at Mau railway station in U.P., Kashi Express evacuated
content: Bomb disposal squads were pressed into service and intensive checking of all coaches was carried out, while platform number one and surrounding areas were cordoned off as a precaution

title: Mysuru court premises evacuated over ‘bomb threat’
content: A police team along with bomb disposal squad rushed to the spot and cordoned off the premises to conduct a thorough search.

title: Supreme Court rejects PIL seeking enforcement of Lyngdoh Committee norms on student polls
content: The top court had accepted the committee recommendations, making them mandatory for all universities and colleges in the country

title: INICIO 2026 expo to bring Ireland’s universities closer to Indian students
content: To be held virtually on January 9 and 10, the event is designed to provide students with first-hand insights into higher education opportunities in Ireland. ‘The Hindu’ is the official media partner

title: Drug situation severe in Haryana: Congress' Surjewala slams BJP government
content: Randeep Singh Surjewala claimed that drugs have reached villages, towns and residential colonies, turning into a major social problem

title: IRCTC scam case: Delhi HC asks CBI to reply to Tejashwi Yadav’s plea against charge framing order
content: Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma issued notice to the CBI on Mr. Tejashwi’s petition and stay application, and listed the matter for further hearing on January 14, when Lalu Prasad Yadav’s similar plea will also be heard

title: Nearly 20 kg heroin recovered in Punjab, four accused apprehended
content: "An FIR has been registered under the NDPS Act, and the investigation is underway to identify cross-border handlers, trace supply routes, and dismantle the entire network," says the DGP

title: ISRO invites proposals from Indian scientists to analyse data from Aditya-L1 mission
content: At present there are more than 23 TB data in public domain and several important scientific results have been published in International peer reviewed journals

title: Suresh Kalmadi: prominent political figure and sports administrator
content: Kalmadi was elected to the Lok Sabha in 1996 and also in 2004. During Narasimha Rao-tenure, Suresh Kalmadi served as the Minister of State for Railways from 1995-1996

title: Probe into Manipur twin blasts handed over to NIA
content: Two persons were injured in the consecutive explosions that rocked Ngaukon in the Phougakchao police station area January 5

title: Delhi AQI remains ‘poor’, shallow fog observed
content: The Air Quality Early Warning System indicated that the Delhi’s air is expected to remain in the poor to very poor range over the next six days

title: Serious irregularities in Assam draft electoral roll after Special Revision, claims Congress
content: Leader of Opposition Debabrata Saikia demanded the halt of the finalisation of the electoral rolls until "all irregularities are thoroughly verified and resolved" to ensure the removal of any unauthorised or "unknown" voter entries

title: Suresh Kalmadi, former Union Minister and Congress leader, passes away at 81
content: Suresh Kalmadi had served as Union Minister of State for Railways and was a former president of the Indian Olympic Association (IOA)

title: Indore water contamination: 38 new diarrhoea cases detected, 110 in hospital; death toll 7
content: Six patients have been referred for treatment, and 110 are currently undergoing treatment in hospitals, including 15 in ICUs, officials said

title: Various parts of T.N. to get light to heavy rain from January 7
content: Six districts, including Ramanathapuram and Mayiladuthurai, may experience heavy rain on Friday, and districts such as Cuddalore, Thanjavur, and Villupuram may record intense rainfall on Saturday

title: India launches new e-Business visa for Chinese nationals
content: The new e-Production Investment Business Visa will be issued in about 45 to 50 days after applying, with permission to stay in India for up to six months

title: Two Indians among 6 killed in jeep mishap in Nepal
content: The Indian nationals, hailing from Bihar, were identified as Rajnish Kumar, 42, and Aravind Kumar, 50

title: NGT directs to issue notice to Centre, U.P. govt. on ‘violations’ near Taj Mahal
content: According to the applicant, as per the Supreme Court, any tree felling within a 5 km aerial distance from the Taj Mahal requires prior permission of the top court, irrespective of the number of trees involved

title: AAP govt. faces heat over Punjab’s law and order; Minister holds previous regimes accountable for gangsters ‘having free run’
content: This comes a day after AAP leader and village sarpanch Jharmal Singh was allegedly shot dead at a wedding venue in Amritsar

title: Kavitha sets sights on Siddipet in new political offensive
content: Siddipet constituency has been the stronghold of Mr. Chandrashekhar Rao as he was MLA for five times from 1985 before he resigned in 2004 after winning it

title: Madras High Court stays tender process for widening ECR and constructing an elevated corridor
content: Justice P.T. Asha grants the interim relief till January 27 pursuant to a case filed by an unsuccesful bidder alleging favouritism in grant of contract

title: Union Home Minister Amit Shah participates in Pongal celebration in Tiruchi
content: Earlier in the day, he worshipped at the Sri Jambukeswarar Akilandeswari Temple at Tiruvanaikoil in Tiruchi and the Sri Ranaganathaswamy Temple in Srirangam

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin signs MoU with UN Women on inclusive development
content: The Memorandum of Understanding aims to strengthen institutional capacities for gender-responsive governance

title: Congress MP stands firm on demand for sharing power in Tamil Nadu after Assembly poll
content: Virudhunagar MP B. Manickam Tagore says poll prediction by private organisation states no party, including the DMK, can win on the upcoming election on its own

title: SC refuses to hear plea against Prime Minister offering of chadar at Ajmer Sharif Dargah
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi says the issue is not justiciable and asked the petitioner to seek appropriate relief in the civil suit, which was pending in the trial court on the claim that the dargah was built over the ruins of a Shiva temple

title: Bihar BJP leaders pay rich tribute to late Sushil Kumar Modi on his birth anniversary
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar unveiled his life-size statue in Patna while Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary asserted that in his long political career, Sushil Modi prioritised the fight against corruption, good governance, and development

title: Thirupparankundram issue: Madras High Court to pronounce judgment on T.N.’s appeals on January 6
content: The judges say the issue regarding the restriction imposed on the total number of participants for the Santhanakoodu Urus festival on the hill to 50 will also be discussed in the verdict

title: Haryana CM Saini blames Congress, INDIA bloc for spreading false info about VB-G RAM G scheme
content: The Chief Minister said that MGNREGA, launched nearly two decades ago, was conceived in a different economic and social context.

title: Former Union Minister’s son booked in hit-and-run case in Chhattisgarh; victim critical
content: A police officer confirmed that the accused Balwant Singh alias Lucky, son of BJP MLA Renuka Singh, has been booked for rash and negligent driving and endangering human life

title: DMK government has compromised women’s safety, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: Claiming that use of narcotics was rampant in the State, he alleges that the primary reason behind the offences against women and children is the free movement of drugs

title: West Bengal CM Mamata lays foundation stone of 5-km bridge connecting Sagar Island to mainland
content: Estimated to cost ₹1,670 crore, the four-lane bridge will connect Lot 8 in Kakdwip to Kachuberia on Sagar Island.

title: Students should help take development of the State forward, says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister
content: Stalin says while people-centric schemes have catapulted the State to double-digit growth, there is scope for more development. He launches the distribution of free laptops to college students

title: BJP welcomes Supreme Court decision rejecting bail pleas of Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam
content: At a press conference, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla asked if the Congress, Samajwadi Party, Trinamool Congress, and the Aam Aadmi Party would apologise to the families whose members were killed in the riots

title: What does the SHANTI Bill change? | Explained
content: How open is India’s nuclear sector now? What role will private firms play? What powers does the AERB now have? How self-reliant is India’s nuclear programme? How has nuclear liability changed? Why is the Opposition opposing SHANTI?

title: Congress expresses ‘grave concern’ over ‘unilateral U.S. actions’ in Venezuela
content: Any kinetic action without UN sanction can result in resurgence in ‘primordial rules of statecraft’, the party says

title: Bank in Kochi receives hoax bomb threat
content: The threat messages reportedly claimed that ammonium nitrate had been planted at multiple locations inside the bank

title: Congress targets Centre over Trump’s tariff threat
content: Public displays of bonhomie between PM and the American leader had yielded little diplomatic dividend, says Opposition party

title: 31.8% of Aravalli Range at risk after recent classification, says conservation group
content: The group demanded that the entire Aravalli range be declared a “fully protected zone” with the abolition of any kind of distinction between “hills” and “mountains” based on height

title: Applications invited for admissions to UG programmes including engineering and medical courses
content: Apply for admission to engineering, architecture, pharmacy, medical and medical allied courses in Kerala

title: Gujarat government suspends IAS officer arrested by ED in graft case
content: According to the ED, Mr. Patel allegedly fixed bribe rates ranging between ₹5 and ₹10 per square metre for granting approvals for change of land use

title: Four children wounded by burning painting material in Odisha school
content: Four students sustained burn injuries. Three are out of danger, while one student is undergoing treatment

title: KSRTC plans induction of 644 new buses to strengthen rural services
content: According to officials, the proposed fleet expansion will include 500 regular buses and 144 double-door mofussil buses, with a majority of these vehicles earmarked for rural routes.

title: Kidwai Memorial Institute of Oncology gets ISO 14001:2015 certification for solid waste management
content: The State-run tertiary care cancer institute is one of the few hospitals in the country that are recognised for compliance with international environmental standards

title: BJP alleges govt. allotting flats to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants; Cong. hits back
content: The BJP leaders tried to reach the Kogilu demolition site in buses to hold a protest on Monday, but were stopped by the police. The protest was held in Bagalur

title: TTD to revamp Kalyana Mandapams, digitise sacred jewellery records
content: Executive Officer orders a comprehensive status report on Kalyana Mandapams and calls for upgrades to the Facility Management System app, including QR code access, to enhance the devotee experience.

title: Faridabad Woman Was Hit By A Bullet In 2005. It Was Removed 20 Years Later
content: Two decades after being shot, a Faridabad woman had the bullet removed from her body, surviving all these years completely healthy. She lived a normal life, got married and is now a mother of four children.

title: 'Way Of Protest': Congress Leader Defends Slogans Against PM At JNU
content: Adding fuel to the controversy over slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi allegedly being raised at the JNU campus in Delhi, Congress leader Udit Raj has appeared to justify the sloganeering, saying it was a way of expressing resentment.

title: Will Centre Present Union Budget 2026 On Sunday, February 1? Committee To Decide
content: The suspense over whether the government would present the Union Budget 2026 on a Sunday will end soon. The cabinet committee on parliamentary affairs is likely to meet tomorrow; among the agenda is a decision on when to present the Union Budget.

title: Jharkhand Man Fails UPSC 4 Times, Poses As Top Civil Servant For 7 Years
content: The incident came to light on January 2 when Rajesh Kumar - a resident of Jharkhand's Kukhi - visited the Hussainabad police station seeking the station house officer in connection with a land dispute.

title: Boy, 15, Detained For Spying, Sharing Information With Pak's ISI From J&K
content: A 15-year-old boy from the Samba district of Jammu and Kashmir has been detained for allegedly sharing sensitive information about Indian Army locations and security installations with Pakistan's ISI and terror handlers.

title: Nicolas Maduro's Capture Has A Puerto Rico Angle
content: When US forces took Nicolas Maduro from Venezuela on Saturday, Aguadilla and several other Puerto Rican bases were already home to aircraft and personnel involved in the operation.

title: Trinamool Congress Moves Supreme Court Against Election Commission Over SIR
content: The All India Trinamool Congress (TMC) has moved the Supreme Court against the Election Commission of India (ECI), stepping up its opposition to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Five Questions About Money to Ponder in 2026
content: Stablecoins had their ChatGPT moment in 2025. Payment tokens that were until now used mostly by crypto traders are raring to go mainstream, and not just in the US, where they got regulatory blessing through the Genius Act.

title: Meet Barry Pollack, WikiLeaks Founder's Lawyer Defending Nicolas Maduro
content: Barry J Pollack, the veteran US attorney famed for securing the release of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, is now tasked with defending the Venezuelan leader.

title: Opinion: Opinion | US' Trumped-Up Tariffs Have No Effect On Global Trade
content: Last year was supposed to mark the moment international trade was dismantled. President Donald Trump's tariffs, we were told, were so unprecedented in scale and ambition that they might stop globalisation in its tracks.

title: "Lamp Can Be Lit On Hilltop": High Court Upholds Order In Deepam Row
content: The case arose from a petition filed by Hindu Tamil Party leader Rama Ravikumar, seeking directions to light the Karthigai Deepam (lamp) at the hilltop pillar.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Might Is Right, Again: On America's 'Kidnapping' Of A Sitting President
content: The barrage of visuals showing Maduro, inelegantly dressed, in handcuffs on American soil, are startling but nothing new in the US playbook. Remember Gaddafi and Saddam? Only, the theatre is the neighbourhood and not the faraway 'Middle East'.

title: Gang Uses Toy Pistol To Rob Jewellery Shop In Hyderabad
content: Police have arrested a gang for attempting a daylight robbery at a jewellery shop in Hyderabad using a fake toy pistol to threaten the shop owner.

title: Inside Pakistan's Lobbying Blitz In US To Halt India's Operation Sindoor
content: Newly accessed US government filings reveal an extraordinary lobbying blitz by Pakistan in Washington, exposing the scale of diplomatic pressure Islamabad unleashed as it struggled to blunt India's military response during Operation Sindoor in May 20

title: What Supreme Court's Latest Verdict On Reservations Means For General Candidates
content: The Supreme Court in a recent order clarified that if a reserved category candidate, without availing any relaxation or concession, outperforms general category candidates, such a candidate must be treated as competing for open posts in the recruitme

title: Bengal Poll Officer Stands In Queue For Voter Verification, Sparks Row
content: A rare and controversial situation has emerged in West Bengal's Meteli under Matiali block, where the block development officer (BDO) of Lava block herself has been summoned for a special intensive revision (SIR) hearing.

title: Russian Family Breathes Life Into Abandoned Graves
content: Fearful that memories of the dead could fade away, Natalia Kornilova and her family have made it their mission to bring Russia's old cemeteries back to life, one gravestone at a time.

title: Delcy Rodriguez Becomes New Venezuelan President: The Challenges She Faces
content: Delcy Rodriguez inherits the leadership of a Bolivarian revolution built on a core belief of opposition to American imperialism.

title: He Attended Course On Cybercrime, Then Went On To Loot Hyderabad ATM
content: A man from Andhra Pradesh who came to Hyderabad to attend a cybercrime course was arrested for stealing cash from ATMs using the techniques he learned during the training.

title: Men's boxers to watch in 2026: Ryan Garcia, Jake Paul, others
content: five fighters could break through in 2026 and make a run at the top of their respective divisions . in 2025, he lost to Rolando "Rolly" Romero in may and was expelled from the WBC in July for repeatedly using racial slurs . the door is opening for a new generation to emerge .

title: Indore deaths: SDM suspended after nod to Congress stir over Kailash Vijayvargiya remarks
content: the sub-divisional magistrate of MP's dewas district was suspended for alleged misconduct . he was responding to "14 water-contamination deaths" in Indore . minister Kailash Vijayvargiya cites "dereliction of duty in signing an order without properly vetting it"

title: Early wild card bets: How to bet Packers-Bears, Bills-Jaguars
content: the playoffs kick off with the Los Angeles Rams at the Carolina Panthers, followed by the Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears . on Sunday, the red-hot Houston Texans hit the road to face the Pittsburgh Steelers .

title: 'It's pretty emotional': Rodgers' take on returning to playoffs tops Week 18 quotes
content: the Pittsburgh Steelers host the Baltimore Ravens in a win-or-go-home showdown . players and coaches carried the intensity from the field to the podium . here are some of the best quotes from around the NFL in Week 18 .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the first rankings of 2026 came with plenty of change after the LSU Tigers , Maryland Terrapins and Iowa State Cyclones all lost . ranked no. 5, 6, 7, 8 and 10 from the previous poll all lost in the last four days .

title: Detroit bakery serves up life-size cake of Lions stars
content: the viral "Spider-Man + Superman" celebration has taken on a life of its own . amon-Ra St. Brown flies over a crouching Gibbs after his 78-yard touchdown run . the home bakery in Rochester, Michigan, recreated another life-size cake .

title: 2026 Unrivaled megapreview: Rosters, rankings, rules, how to watch
content: 54 of the league's top players are in Miami as the second season of unrivaled tips off . the 3-on-3 league was created to give players a domestic offseason playing opportunity . each member of this season's championship team will win an additional $100,000 .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: How Cowboys wasted one of Dak Prescott's best seasons
content: dak Prescott had surgery for a right hamstring avulsion that ended his 2024 season . it was the third time in five seasons he had missed significant time because of injury . he threw for more than 4,000 yards and had at least 30 touchdown passes .

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams
content: the 2026 offseason has begun for the 18 teams that did not make the postseason . we have next steps for all 18 franchises . what big decisions are on deck for each front office? we have a big offseason prediction for every eliminated team .

title: What does Pete Carroll's exit mean for the Raiders, Geno Smith?
content: Pete Carroll led the Raiders to a 3-14 record -- his worst as a coach . the 74-year-old was fired on monday with 17 games into his three-year deal . he was "blindly optimistic" about the talent on the roster .

title: Ranking the best QBs in the transfer portal
content: ESPN's rankings of the top quarterbacks in the transfer portal . the most coveted passers on the board are quickly locking in decisions on their next stop . a year later, it's Indiana, Oregon, Ole Miss and Miami in the college football playoff semifinals .

title: Pistons, Knicks and big questions along the race for the East's top seed
content: the new york Knicks and Detroit Pistons face off as the top two seeds in the Eastern Conference . the two teams have ramped-up expectations for the first time since the series . they are the newly crowned NBA Cup champions, led by the steady Brunson .

title: 'Bing Bong': Detroit Pistons troll New York Knicks after big win
content: the Pistons beat the new york Knicks 121-90 on monday . the win marks the fourth-largest regular-season victory over new york in franchise history . they wrote "Bing Bong" in their postgame caption .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: UP govt grants one-time 3-year age relaxation for 32,679 police recruitment posts
content: the age relaxation will apply to all categories of candidates for the proposed 2025 direct recruitment to the police force . the decision is expected to benefit aspirants who missed earlier recruitment opportunities due to age limits, especially after delays caused by the pandemic period .

title: Trump trumpets Donroe Doctrine, warning Colombia, Cuba, and Mexico
content: a cascade of incendiary remarks following the unprecedented US military operation that captured Venezuelan strongman Nicolás Maduro . he laid out a combative and blunt force vision for US policy toward Latin American countries – and even as far as Greenland and Iran – claiming Washington’s right to shape outcomes across the Western Hemisphere and strategic regions . the remarks began with a blistering attack on Colombia’s president, Gustavo Petro .
